conditions.description: All of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
conditions.markdownDescription: All of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.

chance.description: The value to compare the randomly generated number to.
chance.markdownDescription: The value to compare the randomly generated number to.

type.description:
## Chance

---



[Meta Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/chance)

Generates a random number between 0.0 and 1.0 and checks if it's less than a specified value.

Type ID: `origins:chance`




---

###	Examples

```json
"condition": {
	"type": "origins:chance",
	"chance": 0.5
}
```

This example will evaluate to true 50% of the time.

undefined## Chance

---



[Meta Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/chance)

Generates a random number between 0.0 and 1.0 and checks if it's less than a specified value.

Type ID: `origins:chance`




---

###	Examples

```json
"condition": {
	"type": "origins:chance",

```

This example will evaluate to true 50% of the time.

value.description: If true, the condition is always fulfilled. If false, the condition is never fulfilled.
value.markdownDescription: If true, the condition is always fulfilled. If false, the condition is never fulfilled.

type.description:
## Constant

---



[Meta Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/meta_condition_types/constant)

Provides a constant state where it's either true or false. Mainly added as a backup case in case a condition is required in some power/action/condition types.

Type ID: `origins:constant`




---

### Examples

```json
"condition": {
    "type": "origins:constant",
    "value": true
}
```

This example is always true.
type.markdownDescription:
undefined## Constant

Provides a constant state where it's either true or false. Mainly added as a backup case in case a condition is required in some power/action/condition types.

Type ID: `origins:constant`




---

### Examples

```json
"condition": {
    "type": "origins:constant",
    "value": true
}
```

This example is always true.

conditions.description: Any of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
conditions.markdownDescription: Any of these condition types have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.

type.description:
## Damage Condition Types

---



Damage Condition Types operate on a combination of `DamageSource` and `Float`, allowing to check not only the type of damage dealt, but also how much damage was dealt. These are available to power/condition types that provides a `damage_condition` object field.




---
type.markdownDescription:
undefined## Damage Condition Types
